channel.title: Venezuela's Constitution Constitution of 1999 on Superphysics
channel.description: Recent content in Venezuela's Constitution Constitution of 1999 on Superphysics

item.title: Fundamental Principles
item.description: Article 1 The Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela is irrevocably free and independent, basing its moral property and values of freedom, equality, justice and international peace on the doctrine of Simon Bolivar, the Liberator. Independence, liberty, sovereignty, immunity, territorial integrity and national self- determination are unrenounceable rights of the Nation. Article 2 Venezuela constitutes itself as a Democratic and Social State of Law and Justice, which holds as superior values of its legal order and actions those of life, liberty, justice, equality, solidarity, democracy, social responsibility and, in general, the preeminence of human rights, ethics and political pluralism.
